summary: pnpm cache config fix in CI workflows

message.content: Which e2e testing tools are used in this workspce?

content.text: I'll check which e2e testing tools are used in this Nx workspace.

input.prompt:
Search through the Nx workspace to identify which e2e testing tools are being used. Look for:
1. E2E test directories and projects
2. Testing framework configurations (jest, cypress, playwright, etc.)
3. Package.json dependencies related to e2e testing
4. Any e2e-related scripts or configurations

Return a concise summary of which e2e testing tools are used in this workspace.

message.content:
Search through the Nx workspace to identify which e2e testing tools are being used. Look for:
1. E2E test directories and projects
2. Testing framework configurations (jest, cypress, playwright, etc.)
3. Package.json dependencies related to e2e testing
4. Any e2e-related scripts or configurations

Return a concise summary of which e2e testing tools are used in this workspace.

content.text: I'll search through the Nx workspace to identify the e2e testing tools being used.

Below is the content of nx.json, the configuration file for the Nx workspace.
        It is at the root of the workspace and defines how nx is configured.
        The file contents are annotated marked with <></> with descriptions to help you understand each piece better. The original nx.json does not contain these annotations.
        The user cannot see this nx.json file or the annotations in this conversation, so don't reference them directly. Explain any reference you make to them clearly.
        The nx.json can be changed only if the user query involves making changes to the Nx workspace configuration - don't suggest changes too eagerly.

     2	  "name": "@nx/nx-source",
     3	  "description": "Smart Repos · Fast Builds",
     4	  "homepage": "https://nx.dev",
     5	  "private": true,
     6	  "scripts": {
     7	    "build": "nx run-many --target build --parallel 8 --exclude nx-dev,typedoc-theme,tools-documentation-create-embeddings,nx-dev-util-ai",
     8	    "commit": "czg",
     9	    "check-commit": "node ./scripts/commit-lint.js",
    10	    "check-format": "nx format:check --all",
    11	    "check-format:quick": "pretty-quick --check",
    12	    "check-imports": "node ./scripts/check-imports.js",
    13	    "check-lock-files": "node ./scripts/check-lock-files.js",
    14	    "check-documentation-map": "ts-node -P ./scripts/tsconfig.scripts.json ./scripts/documentation/map-link-checker.ts",
    15	    "check-codeowners": "ts-node -P ./scripts/tsconfig.scripts.json ./scripts/check-codeowners.ts",
    16	    "nx-release": "nx nx-release @nx/nx-source --parallel 8",
    17	    "prepublishOnly": "node ./scripts/update-package-group.js",
    18	    "local-registry": "nx local-registry @nx/nx-source",
    19	    "documentation": "nx documentation",
    20	    "submit-plugin": "node ./scripts/submit-plugin.js",
    21	    "prepare": "is-ci || husky",
    22	    "echo": "echo 123458",
    23	    "preinstall": "node ./scripts/preinstall.js",
    24	    "test": "nx run-many -t test",
    25	    "e2e": "nx run-many -t e2e --projects ./e2e/*",
    26	    "build:wasm": "rustup override set nightly-2025-05-09 && rustup target add wasm32-wasip1-threads && WASI_SDK_PATH=\"$(pwd)/wasi-sdk-23.0-x86_64-linux\" CMAKE_BUILD_PARALLEL_LEVEL=2 LIBSQLITE3_FLAGS=\"-DLONGDOUBLE_TYPE=double\" pnpm exec nx run-many -t build-native-wasm && rustup override unset",
    27	    "lint-pnpm-lock": "eslint pnpm-lock.yaml"
    28	  },
    29	  "devDependencies": {
    30	    "@actions/core": "^1.10.0",
    31	    "@angular-devkit/architect": "0.2000.0-rc.3",
    32	    "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "20.0.0-rc.3",
    33	    "@angular-devkit/core": "20.0.0-rc.3",

    43	    "@angular/core": "20.0.0-rc.2",
    44	    "@angular/platform-browser": "20.0.0-rc.2",

file.content:
{
  "name": "@nx/nx-source",
  "description": "Smart Repos · Fast Builds",
  "homepage": "https://nx.dev",
  "private": true,
  "scripts": {
    "build": "nx run-many --target build --parallel 8 --exclude nx-dev,typedoc-theme,tools-documentation-create-embeddings,nx-dev-util-ai",
    "commit": "czg",
    "check-commit": "node ./scripts/commit-lint.js",
    "check-format": "nx format:check --all",
    "check-format:quick": "pretty-quick --check",
    "check-imports": "node ./scripts/check-imports.js",
    "check-lock-files": "node ./scripts/check-lock-files.js",
    "check-documentation-map": "ts-node -P ./scripts/tsconfig.scripts.json ./scripts/documentation/map-link-checker.ts",
    "check-codeowners": "ts-node -P ./scripts/tsconfig.scripts.json ./scripts/check-codeowners.ts",
    "nx-release": "nx nx-release @nx/nx-source --parallel 8",
    "prepublishOnly": "node ./scripts/update-package-group.js",
    "local-registry": "nx local-registry @nx/nx-source",
    "documentation": "nx documentation",
    "submit-plugin": "node ./scripts/submit-plugin.js",
    "prepare": "is-ci || husky",
    "echo": "echo 123458",
    "preinstall": "node ./scripts/preinstall.js",
    "test": "nx run-many -t test",
    "e2e": "nx run-many -t e2e --projects ./e2e/*",
    "build:wasm": "rustup override set nightly-2025-05-09 && rustup target add wasm32-wasip1-threads && WASI_SDK_PATH=\"$(pwd)/wasi-sdk-23.0-x86_64-linux\" CMAKE_BUILD_PARALLEL_LEVEL=2 LIBSQLITE3_FLAGS=\"-DLONGDOUBLE_TYPE=double\" pnpm exec nx run-many -t build-native-wasm && rustup override unset",
    "lint-pnpm-lock": "eslint pnpm-lock.yaml"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@actions/core": "^1.10.0",
    "@angular-devkit/architect": "0.2000.0-rc.3",
    "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "20.0.0-rc.3",
    "@angular-devkit/core": "20.0.0-rc.3",
    "@angular-devkit/schematics": "20.0.0-rc.3",
    "@angular-eslint/eslint-plugin": "19.2.0",
    "@angular-eslint/eslint-plugin-template": "19.2.0",
    "@angular-eslint/template-parser": "19.2.0",
    "@angular/build": "20.0.0-rc.3",
    "@angular/cli": "20.0.0-rc.3",
    "@angular/common": "20.0.0-rc.2",
    "@angular/compiler": "20.0.0-rc.2",
    "@angular/compiler-cli": "20.0.0-rc.2",
    "@angular/core": "20.0.0-rc.2",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "20.0.0-rc.2",
    "@angular/router": "20.0.0-rc.2",
    "@astrojs/check": "^0.7.0",
    "@astrojs/react": "^3.6.2",
    "@babel/core": "^7.23.2",
    "@babel/helper-create-regexp-features-plugin": "^7.22.9",
    "@babel/plugin-transform-runtime": "^7.23.2",

input.content:
# E2E Testing Tools Analysis

## Search Completed
Analyzed the Nx workspace to identify e2e testing tools.

## Key Findings

### 1. Primary E2E Testing Frameworks
- **Cypress**: Full package at `/packages/cypress/` with executors and generators
- **Playwright**: Full package at `/packages/playwright/` with executors and generators  
- **Detox**: Full package at `/packages/detox/` for React Native mobile testing

### 2. E2E Test Projects Structure
- Extensive `/e2e/` directory with 25+ test projects
- Each framework has dedicated test suites (angular, react, node, etc.)
- Tests use Jest as the test runner for the e2e test files themselves

### 3. Graph Client E2E
- Dedicated Cypress setup for testing the Nx graph client UI
- Multiple Cypress configurations for different modes (dev, release, static)

### 4. Jest Integration
- Jest preset specifically for e2e tests (`jest.preset.e2e.js`)
- All e2e projects use Jest configs for running the actual test files

## Summary
Nx uses three main e2e testing tools:
1. **Cypress** - Web integration testing
2. **Playwright** - Modern web testing alternative
3. **Detox** - React Native mobile app testing

The e2e tests themselves are orchestrated using Jest as the test runner.

toolUseResult.content:
# E2E Testing Tools Analysis

## Search Completed
Analyzed the Nx workspace to identify e2e testing tools.

## Key Findings

### 1. Primary E2E Testing Frameworks
- **Cypress**: Full package at `/packages/cypress/` with executors and generators
- **Playwright**: Full package at `/packages/playwright/` with executors and generators  
- **Detox**: Full package at `/packages/detox/` for React Native mobile testing

### 2. E2E Test Projects Structure
- Extensive `/e2e/` directory with 25+ test projects
- Each framework has dedicated test suites (angular, react, node, etc.)
- Tests use Jest as the test runner for the e2e test files themselves

### 3. Graph Client E2E
- Dedicated Cypress setup for testing the Nx graph client UI
- Multiple Cypress configurations for different modes (dev, release, static)

### 4. Jest Integration
- Jest preset specifically for e2e tests (`jest.preset.e2e.js`)
- All e2e projects use Jest configs for running the actual test files

## Summary
Nx uses three main e2e testing tools:
1. **Cypress** - Web integration testing
2. **Playwright** - Modern web testing alternative
3. **Detox** - React Native mobile app testing

The e2e tests themselves are orchestrated using Jest as the test runner.

content.text:
## E2E Testing Tools in Nx Workspace

Based on my analysis, the Nx workspace uses **three main e2e testing frameworks**:

### 1. **Cypress** 
- Full Nx plugin at `/packages/cypress/`
- Provides executors and generators for web integration testing
- Used for testing the Nx graph client UI (in `/graph/client-e2e/`)

### 2. **Playwright**
- Full Nx plugin at `/packages/playwright/` 
- Modern alternative to Cypress for web testing
- Includes executors and generators for integration testing

### 3. **Detox**
- Full Nx plugin at `/packages/detox/`
- Specialized for React Native mobile app testing
- Handles mobile-specific testing scenarios

### Test Organization
- The `/e2e/` directory contains 25+ test projects covering different frameworks (Angular, React, Node, etc.)
- **Jest** serves as the test runner for executing the actual e2e test files
- Each testing tool has its own dedicated test suites to validate functionality

Think of it like a testing toolkit: Cypress and Playwright handle web apps, Detox handles mobile apps, and Jest orchestrates running all the tests. Each tool specializes in its domain, giving developers flexibility to choose the right testing approach for their project type.

## E2E Testing Tools in Nx Workspace

Based on my analysis, the Nx workspace uses **three main e2e testing frameworks**:

### 1. **Cypress** 
- Full Nx plugin at `/packages/cypress/`
- Provides executors and generators for web integration testing
- Used for testing the Nx graph client UI (in `/graph/client-e2e/`)

### 2. **Playwright**
- Full Nx plugin at `/packages/playwright/` 
- Modern alternative to Cypress for web testing
- Includes executors and generators for integration testing

### 3. **Detox**
- Full Nx plugin at `/packages/detox/`
- Specialized for React Native mobile app testing
- Handles mobile-specific testing scenarios
